title: Projection Mapping
content: Projection mapped & created content for large scale productions for live and corporate events

sections.title: Overview
sections.content: I have had the opportunity to create content and projection map large scale buildings for both live music productions and corporate clients. With projection mapping, every project brings a very different set of challenges; ambient light, projector placements (avoiding things like shadows) or hard to work with structural elements to name a few. When working on a projection mapping project, my primary motivator is transforming the space into something the viewers would never expect. Whether its using “invisible” lights, adding structural elements, or simply adding abstract design to highlight different areas, every project is approached with the unique space and facade in mind.

sections.title: Orion Amphitheater
sections.content: I was the Lead Artist, Video Operator (VJ) and Creative Director behind one night of Tipper’s 3 night retirement show  at the Orion Amphitheater in Huntsville, Alabama. Without any preview of the music that would be performed, I was tasked with creating a full 75 minute show that incorporated projection mapping of the entire facade as well as a large center screen. The entire projection surface was over 250 feet wide, utilizing six 40k lumen projectors. Using a mixture of pre-rendered and generative sources, I worked with Theron Pray to mix content in real-time on the facade and the center screen, live to the music.

sections.title: Bizzell Memorial Library
sections.content: I was brought on as a content creator and advisor by Hunter Owen (Laserwolf FX) to help with projection mapping the Bizzell Library at the University of Oklahoma for their Holiday show. The client was specifically looking for a dozen different holiday related scenes that would transform the library. Mapping and projection work were done by Hunter Owen and his team.

sections.title: Spirit of Suwannee Music Park & The Gorge Amphitheater
sections.content: On two different occasions, I was granted the opportunity to projection map a beautifully designed stage piece by TAS visuals. The stage was expertly fabricated and painted by Hoodie Salinas and his team Given the output map very early in the planning process provided for a rare opportunity to make ample content that fit the stage. Additionally, the proximity of the stage piece to a lower LED wall offered a unique chance to either separate the elements with two distinct visuals, or to unify them and create one cohesive shape.

sections.title: Echo Mountain
sections.content: I was a Video Operator (VJ), content creator and an advisor for the projection mapping work flow at this event produced by Shakedown Productions at Echo Mountain in Colorado. The stage was designed by David Fratu (Ill.des) and fabricated by Shakedown Productions.
